‘They’re drunk… They’re brutal… not our problem!’ his dad said. He hugged his father but felt suffocated, like he couldn’t breathe. Then he woke up.

Gasping for air, his hair drenched in sweat, he shot up in fear. ‘Thank God, just a dream,’ he said, slumping under a tree and taking deep breaths. ‘But what’s going on? Is this a fever? That was a nightmare!’

He felt completely shattered; darkness and confusion clouded his mind. He rested his elbows on his knees and buried his head in his hands. 

‘Good God!’ he exclaimed, ‘is it possible that I could really take an axe, smash her head, split her skull… step in the warm blood, break in, steal, and hide, all covered in blood… with the axe… Good God, can it be?’

He was trembling as he spoke. 

‘But why am I thinking like this?’ he asked, sitting up in shock. ‘I know I could never actually do it, so why have I been torturing myself? Yesterday, when I went to… test it, I realized I could never go through with it… So why am I still hesitating? When I went down the stairs yesterday, I told myself it was disgusting, vile… just the thought made me sick and horrified.’

‘No, I couldn’t do it, I couldn’t do it! Sure, sure that…’

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist is tormented by a horrifying dream that forces him to confront his inner turmoil and the possibility of committing a violent act he believes he cannot carry out.
